files.actual_value: metadata.name={{viewer}}.rules[0].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{committer}}.rules[1].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{owner}}.rules[0].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=crier.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=crier.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=crier.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=crier.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=owner.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=owner.rules.resources contains a wildcard value

files.actual_value: metadata.name=committer.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=committer.rules.resources contains a wildcard value

files.actual_value: metadata.name=tekton-bot.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=tekton-bot.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to attach to containers via 'kubectl attach' could be abused by attackers to read log output (stdout, stderr) and send input data (stdin) to running processes. Additionally, it would allow a malicious user to attach to a privileged container resulting in a privilege escalation attack. To prevent this, the 'pods/attach' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to port-forward into pods can open socket-level communication channels to containers. In case of compromise, attackers may abuse this for direct communication that bypasses network security restrictions

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{gcpreviews}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{gcpreviews}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: list, get, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{tekton-bot}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{tekton-bot}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: list, get, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{tekton-pipelines}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{tekton-pipelines}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, create, update, delete, patch, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{gcactivities}}.rules[2] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{gcactivities}}.rules[2] is granted read access (verbs: get) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

Containers must not be allowed to run with root privileges, which means the attributes 'privileged','allowPrivilegeEscalation' and 'readOnlyRootFilesystem' must be set to false, 'runAsUser.rule' must be set to 'MustRunAsNonRoot', and adding the root group must be forbidden
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{crier}}.apiVersion of Role  is deprecated and is {{rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{plank}}.apiVersion of Deployment  is deprecated and is {{extensions/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{hook}}.apiVersion of Deployment  is deprecated and is {{extensions/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{sinker}}.apiVersion of Deployment  is deprecated and is {{extensions/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{release-name-chartmuseum}}.apiVersion of Deployment  is deprecated and is {{extensions/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{tekton-pipelines-controller}}.apiVersion of Deployment  is deprecated and is {{apps/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{deck}}.apiVersion of RoleBinding  is deprecated and is {{rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1}}
